{rhaque\f\tsnaskar\f\tjosef\f\taway}@computing.dcu.ie\t Abs\trac\t.\t Statistica\b\t Machine\t Trans\bation\t (SMT)\t systems\t are\t usua\b\by\t trained\t on\t \barge\t amounts\tof\tbi\bingua\b\ttext\tand\tmono\bingua\b\ttarget\t\banguage\ttext.\tIf\t a\t significant\t amount\t of\t out-of-domain\tdata\tis\tadded\tto\tthe\ttraining\tdata\f\tthe\tqua\bity\tof\ttrans\bation\tcan\tdrop.\tOn\tthe\t other\t hand\f\t training\t an\t SMT\t system\t on\t a\t sma\b\b\t amount\t of\t training\t materia\b\t for\t given\t indomain\tdata\t\beads\tto\tnarrow\t\bexica\b\tcoverage\twhich\tagain\tresu\bts\tin\ta\t\bow\ttrans\bation\tqua\bity.\t In\tthis\tpaper\f\t(i)\twe\texp\bore\tdomain-adaptation\ttechniques\tto\tcombine\t\barge\tout-of-domain\t training\tdata\twith\tsma\b\b-sca\be\tin-domain\ttraining\tdata\tfor\tEng\bish—Hindi\tstatistica\b\tmachine\t trans\bation\tand\t(ii)\twe\tc\buster\t\barge\tout-of-domain\ttraining\tdata\tto\textract\tsentences\tsimi\bar\t to\tin-domain\tsentences\t and\t app\by\t adaptation\t techniques\t to\t combine\t c\bustered\t sub-corpora\t with\t in-domain\t training\t data\t into\t a\t unified\t framework\f\t achieving\t a\t 0.44\t abso\bute\t corresponding\tto\ta\t4.03%\tre\bative\timprovement\tin\tterms\tof\tBLEU\t\tover\tthe\tbase\bine. \t Keyw\frds: statistica\b\tmachine\ttrans\bation\f\tdomain\tadaptation\t \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\S\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t \t \t \t Copyright\t2009\tby\tRejwanu\b\tHaque\f\tSudip\tKumar\tNaskar\f\tJosef\tvan\tGenabith\f\tand\tAndy\tWay\t

sections.title: 1 I\b\tr\fduc\ti\f\b
paragraphs: In\t genera\b\f\t SMT\t mode\bs\t are\t trained\t on\t \barge\t corpora\t which\t may\t inc\bude\t quite\t heterogeneous\t topics.\tThese\ttopics\tusua\b\by\tdefine\ta\tset\tof\ttermino\bogica\b\t\bexicons.\tTermino\bogies\tneed\tto\tbe\t trans\bated\t taking\t into\t account\t the\t semantic\t context\t in\t which\t they\t appear.\t The\t semantic\t dependency\tprob\bem\tcou\bd\tbe\tovercome\tby\t\bearning\ttopic-dependent\ttrans\bation\tmode\bs.\tThere\t has\tbeen\tincreased\tinterest\tin\tincorporating\tdata\tfrom\tdomains\twith\tsufficient\tdata\tin\torder\tto\t improve\ttrans\bation\tqua\bity\tfor\tsma\b\b-data\tdomains.\t

Severa\b\tapproaches\thave\tbeen\tapp\bied\tto\tdomain\tadaptation\tsuch\tas\tusing\ttwo\tphrase\ttab\bes\t joint\by\twith\ta\tdata\tsource\tindicator\tfeature\tadded\tto\tthe\t\bog-\binear\tcombination\t(Nakov\f\t2008)\f\t which\t has\t shown\t good\t resu\bts.\t Some\t researchers\t use\t mu\btip\be\t decoding\t paths\t of\t PB-SMT\t decoders\t such\t as\t Moses\t (Koehn\tet al.\f\t 2007)\t for\t mu\bti\t domain\t mode\b\t adaptation\t (Koehn\t and\t Schroeder\f\t 2007).\t Adaptations\t on\t the\t a\bignment\t mode\b\t have\t been\t investigated\t where\t word\t a\bignments\t\bearned\tfrom\ta\t\barge\tout-of-domain\tcorpus\tare\tused\tto\ta\bign\twords\tfor\ta\tsma\b\b-sca\be\t domain\t (Wu\tet al.\f\t 2005).\t Some\t researchers\t proposed\t a\t way\t to\t retrieve\t on\by\t those\t sentences\t which\t are\t most\t simi\bar\t to\t the\t test\t data\t in\t order\t to\t improve\t the\t training\t data’s\t match\t with\t respect\tto\tdomain\f\ttopic\f\tand\tsty\be\t(Eck\tet al.\f\t2004).\tRecent\by\f\tresearchers\tincorporate\tout-of-domain\t data\t through\t \bearning\t phrase\t temp\bates\t (phrase\t genera\bisation)\t in\t order\t to\t improve\t trans\bation\tqua\bity\t(Lim\tand\tKirchhoff\f\t2008).\t\t

In\t the\t present\t work\f\t we\t conduct\t experiments\t on\t the\t Eng\bish—Hindi\t \banguage\t pair.\t Like\t other\t Indian\t \banguages\f\t Hindi\t is\t a\bso\t a\t free\t phrase\t order\t (used\t with\t emphasis\t and\t comp\bex\t structures)\t\banguage.\tTherefore\f\tapp\bying\tadaptation\ttechniques\ton\tsuch\ta\t\banguage\tpair\tcou\bd\t produce\tinteresting\tfindings.\t\t

For\tadaptation\tpurposes\f\tprevious\tresearch\tused\tsimi\barity\tmetrics\tto\tc\buster\theterogeneous\t corpus\t data\t into\t sub-corpora\t with\t homogeneous\t topics.\t In\t order\t to\t compute\t the\t distance\t 670 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 670–677 \t between\ta\tsentence\tand\ta\tc\buster\f\tdifferent\tsimi\barity\tmetrics\thave\tbeen\tproposed.\t(Carter\f\t1994)\t introduced\tan\tentropy\treduction\tbased\tsimi\barity\tmetric\tto\tc\buster\ta\tmu\bti-domain\tmono\bingua\b\t corpus.\tA\tregu\bar\texpression\tbased\tsimi\barity\tfunction\thas\tbeen\tdefined\tto\tbui\bd\tc\bass\tspecific\t \banguage\t mode\bs\t (Hasan\t and\t Ney\f\t 2005).\t In\t our\t research\f\t we\t exp\bore\t a\t c\bustering\t technique\t based\ton\tan\tn-gram\tover\bap\tmetric\tto\textract\tsentences\tsimi\bar\tto\tin-domain\ttext\tfrom\t\barge\tout-of-domain\ttraining\tdata.\t

We\temp\boy\tdomain\tadaptation\ttechniques\tto\tadapt\tan\tout-of-domain\tbi\bingua\b\tcorpus\tto\tan\t in-domain\tSMT\tmode\b\tusing\tc\bustering\tto\textract\tsentences\tsimi\bar\tto\tin-domain\ttext\tfrom\t\barge\t out-of-domain\ttraining\tdata.\tWe\tapp\by\t adaptation\t techniques\t to\t combine\t sub-corpora\t with\t indomain\tsma\b\b-sca\be\ttraining\tdata\tinto\ta\tunified\tframework.\t

The\t remainder\t of\t the\t paper\t is\t organized\t as\t fo\b\bows.\t In\t section\t 2\t we\t discuss\t re\bated\t work.\t Section\t 3\t describes\t experimenta\b\t resu\bts\t using\t our\t base\bine\t SMT\t mode\b.\t In\t section\t 4\t we\t describe\t the\t domain\t adaptation\t techniques\t which\t are\t emp\boyed\t to\t combine\t mu\btip\be\t mode\bs.\t Section\t5\tpresents\tthe\tresu\bts\tobtained\f\ttogether\twith\tsome\tana\bysis.\tSection\t6\tconc\budes\f\tand\t provides\tavenues\tfor\tfurther\twork.\t

sections.title: 2 Rela\ted W\frk
paragraphs: Topic-dependent\tmode\bing\twas\teffective\by\tapp\bied\tin\tspeech\trecognition\tto\timprove\tthe\tqua\bity\t of\tmode\bs\t(Carter\f\t1994).\tAdaptation\ttechno\bogy\thas\tbeen\twide\by\tused\tin\t\banguage\tmode\bing\tin\t the\tsame\tfi\bed\tover\tthe\t\bast\tdecade\t(Iyer\tet al.\f\t1997).

Lang\bais\t (2002)\t was\t the\t first\t to\t introduce\t domain\t adaptation\t in\t SMT\t by\t integrating\t termino\bogica\b\t \bexicons\t in\t the\t trans\bation\t mode\b\t resu\bting\t in\t a\t significant\t reduction\t in\t word\t error\t rate\t (WER).\t Over\t the\t \bast\t years\f\t many\t researchers\t have\t investigated\t the\t prob\bem\t of\t combining\tmu\bti-domain\tdata.\tWu\tand\tWang\t(2004)\tand\tWu\tet al.\t(2005)\tpropose\tan\ta\bignment\t adaptation\tapproach\tto\timprove\tdomain-specific\tword\ta\bignment.\t

Eck\tet al.\t(2004)\t present\t a\t \banguage\t mode\b\t (LM)\t adaptation\t technique\t in\t SMT\t app\bying\t information\t retrieva\b\t theory\t fo\b\bowing\t the\t approach\t of\t Mahajan\tet al.\t (1999)\t in\t speech\t recognition.\tThis\tapproach\twas\tfurther\trefined\tby\tZhao\tet al.\t(2004).\tHi\bdebrand\tet al.\t(2005)\t adapt\t the\t trans\bation\t mode\b\t by\t se\becting\t simi\bar\t sentences\t from\t the\t avai\bab\be\t training\t data\t app\bying\t the\t approach\t of\t Eck\tet al.\t (2004).\t The\t adapted\t mode\bs\t significant\by\t improve\t the\t trans\bation\tperformance\tcompared\tto\tbase\bine\tsystems.\t

More\t recent\by\f\t Bu\byko\tet al.\f\t (2007)\t studied\t \banguage\t mode\b\t adaptation\t for\t SMT.\t They\t exp\bored\tdiscriminative\testimation\tof\t\banguage\tmode\b\tweights\tby\tdirect\by\toptimizing\tmachine\t trans\bation\t eva\buation\t metrics\t such\t as\t BLEU\t score.\t An\t improvement\t 0.4\t BLEU\t score\t was\t reported.\t

Hasan\tand\tNey\t(2005)\tc\buster\t the\t training\t sentences\t into\t specific\t c\basses\t based\t on\t regu\bar\t expressions\tto\tbui\bd\tc\bass\tspecific\t\banguage\tmode\bs.\tThey\tproposed\ta\tmethod\tof\tinterpo\bating\t c\bass\tspecific\tand\tg\boba\b\t\banguage\tmode\bs\tfo\b\bowing\tthe\tmixture\tmode\b\tproposed\tby\tIyer\tet al.\t (1999).\t The\t resu\bts\t \book\t promising\t in\t terms\t of\t perp\bexity\t reduction\f\t as\t we\b\b\t as\t error\t rates\t obtained\t for\t a\t trans\bation\t task\t using\t an\t\b-best\t \bist\t rescoring\t framework.\t Both\t Yamamoto\t and\t Sumita\t(2007)\tand\tFoster\tand\tKuhn\t(2007)\textended\tthis\twork\tto\tinc\bude\tthe\ttrans\bation\tmode\b.\t Yamamoto\t and\t Sumita\t (2007)\t used\t an\t unsupervised\t c\bustering\t technique\t on\t an\t un\babe\b\bed\t bi\bingua\b\t training\t corpus.\t Each\t c\buster\t is\t regarded\t as\t a\t domain.\t C\busters\t are\t defined\t automatica\b\by\t(without\thuman\tknow\bedge)\tand\tcreated\tby\tthe\tentropy\treduction\tbased\tmethod\t (Carter\f\t 1994).\t Civera\t and\t Juan\t (2007)\t introduce\t the\t mixture\t extension\t for\t HMM\t a\bignment\t mode\bs.\tThis\tapproach\tgenerates\ttopic\tdependent\tviterbi\ta\bignments\tto\tfeed\ta\tstate-of-art\tphrase\t based\tSMT\t(PB-SMT).\t\t

Koehn\tand\tSchroeder\t(2007)\tinvestigated\tdomain\tadaptations\tby\tintegrating\tin-domain\tand\t out-of-domain\t \banguage\t mode\bs\t as\t \bog-\binear\t features\t in\t an\t SMT\t mode\b.\t They\t a\bso\t used\t mu\btip\be\tdecoding\tpaths\t(Birch\tet al.\t2007)\tfor\tcombining\tmu\btip\be\tdomain\ttrans\bation\ttab\bes\tin\t the\tstate-of-the-art\tPB-SMT\tdecoder\tMoses\t(Koehn\tet al.\f\t2003).\t\t 671

Nakov\t(2008)\tcombine\tan\tin-domain\tmode\b\t(trans\bation\tand\treordering\tmode\b)\twith\tan\tout-of-domain\t mode\b\t (trans\bation\t and\t reordering)\t into\t Moses\t (Koehn\tet al.\f\t 2007).\t They\t derived\t \bog-\binear\t features\t to\t distinguish\t between\t phrases\t of\t mu\btip\be\t domains\t by\t app\bying\t the\t datasource\tindicator\tfeatures\tand\tshowed\tmodest\timprovement\tin\ttrans\bation\tqua\bity.\t

Munteanu\tand\tMarcu\t(2006)\tautomatica\b\by\textract\tin-domain\tbi\bingua\b\tsentence\tpairs\tfrom\t \barge\t comparab\be\t corpora\t to\t en\barge\t the\t in-domain\t bi\bingua\b\t corpus.\t They\t showed\t a\t modest\t gain\t over\t the\t base\bine\t system.\t Ueffing\tet al.\t (2007)\t introduced\t transductive\t semi-supervised\t \bearning\tfor\tSMT\f\twhere\tsource\t\banguage\tcorpora\tare\tused\tto\ttrain\tthe\tmode\bs.\tThe\ttransductive\t \bearning\tcan\tbe\tseen\tas\ta\tmeans\tto\tadapt\tthe\tSMT\tsystem\tto\ta\tnew\tdomain.\tSentences\tfrom\tthe\t devset\t or\t testset\t are\t trans\bated\t repeated\by\t and\t the\t generated\t trans\bations\t are\t added\t to\t training\t data\tto\timprove\tthe\tperformance\tof\tthe\tSMT\tsystem.\tThey\treported\ta\tsignificant\timprovement\t of\tBLEU\tover\tthe\tbase\bine.\t\t

Wu\tet al.\t (2008)\t proposed\t a\t method\t to\t perform\t domain\t adaptation\t for\t SMT\f\t where\t indomain\tbi\bingua\b\tdata\tdo\tnot\texist.\tThe\ttransductive\t\bearning\tmethod\t(Ueffing\tet al.\t2007)\thas\t been\tused\tto\tadapt\tthe\tin-domain\tmono\bingua\b\tcorpus.\tWu\tet al.\t(2008)\ta\bso\tshowed\tthat\t\bog- \binear\tinterpo\bation\tperforms\tbetter\tthan\t\binear\tinterpo\bation\tto\tcombine\tin-domain\tand\tout-of-domain\t\banguage\tmode\bs\tas\twe\b\b\tas\ttrans\bation\tmode\bs.\t\t

Snover\tet al.\t(2008)\tdescribes\ta\tnove\b\tdomain\tadaptation\tmethod\tfor\tuti\bizing\tmono\bingua\b\t target\t data\t to\t improve\t the\t performance\t of\t a\t statistica\b\t machine\t trans\bation\t system\t on\t news\t stories.\t For\t the\t trans\bation\t of\t each\t source\t text\f\t a\t \barge\t mono\bingua\b\t data\t set\t in\t the\t target\t \banguage\t is\t searched\t for\t documents\t that\t might\t be\t comparab\be\t to\t the\t source\t text.\t These\t documents\tare\tthen\tused\tto\tadapt\tthe\tMT\tsystem\tto\tincrease\tthe\tprobabi\bity\tof\tgenerating\ttexts\t that\tresemb\be\tthe\tcomparab\be\tdocument.\tExperimenta\b\tresu\bts\tshow\tsubstantia\b\tgains.\t\t

Lim\tand\tKirchhoff\t(2008)\tproposed\ta\tmethod\tfor\tincorporating\tout-of-domain\tdata\tthrough\t phrase\tgenera\bization\tin\torder\tto\timprove\tthe\tIta\bian-Eng\bish\ttrans\bation\tqua\bity.\tThey\tshowed\ta\t noticeab\be\timprovement\tin\ttrans\bation\tqua\bity.\t

Finch\tand\tSumita\t(2008)\temp\boyed\tprobabi\bistic\tmixture\tweights\tto\tcombine\ttwo\tmode\bs\tfor\t questions\t and\t dec\barative\t sentences\t with\t a\t genera\b\t mode\b.\t Foster\t and\t Kuhn\t (2007)\t used\t distance\tbased\tweights\tin\ta\tmixture\tmode\b.\tIn\tcontrast\tto\ttheir\twork\f\tFinch\tand\tSumita\t(2008)\t used\t a\t probabi\bistic\t c\bassifier\t to\t determine\t a\t vector\t of\t probabi\bity\t representing\t c\bassmembership.\t They\t performed\t experiments\t on\t a\t number\t of\t \banguage\t pairs\t and\t experimenta\b\t resu\bts\tshowed\tthe\tusefu\bness\tof\ttheir\tmethod.\t

Domain\t adaptation\t techniques\t can\t be\t broad\by\t divided\t into\t two\t categories:\t (i)\t adaptation\t techniques\tto\timprove\tword\ta\bignment\tmode\bs;\tsuch\tas\tWu\tet al.\t(2005)\tand\tCivera\tand\tJuan\t (2007)\tand\t(ii)\tadaptation\ttechniques\tto\tcombine\tmu\btip\be\tdomain\tmode\bs;\tsuch\tas\tKoehn\tand\t Schroeder\t(2007)\tand\tNakov\t(2008).\tThe\tpresent\twork\tfa\b\bs\tinto\tthe\tsecond\ttype\tof\tadaptation\t method.\t\t

Identifying\tsimi\bar\tsentences\tp\bays\tan\timportant\tro\be\tin\tdomain\tadaptation.\tExperiments\ton\t detecting\tand\tc\bustering\tsimi\bar\tsentences\tfrom\ta\tcorpus\thave\tbeen\textensive\by\tstudied\tin\tmany\t natura\b\t\banguage\tprocessing\tapp\bications.\tSeno\tand\tMaria\t(2008)\tperformed\tc\bustering\tmethods\t to\textract\tsimi\bar\tsentences\tfrom\ttext\tdocuments.\t\t

sections.title: 3 Experime\b\tal Da\ta
paragraphs: The\tshared\ttask\ton\tEng\bish—Hindi\tSMT\t(Venkatapathy\f\t2008)\tre\beased\ttwo\tdifferent\tdatasets:\t\t (1)\t TIDES-IIIT\t Dataset:\t this\t dataset\t was\t co\b\bected\t for\t the\t DARPA-TIDES\t surprise\t \banguage\t contest\t on\t Statistica\b\t Machine\t Trans\bation\t in\t 2002.\t This\t corpus\t is\t genera\b\t domain\t with\t news\t artic\bes\tforming\tthe\tgreatest\tproportion.\tThe\ttraining\f\tdeve\bopment\tand\ttest\tsets\tcontain\t49\f504\f\t 988\tand\t697\tsentences\trespective\by.\t\t (2)\t EILMT-Tourism\t Corpus:\t this\t dataset\t was\t provided\t by\t the\t EILMT\t consortium\t funded\t by\t DIT\f\tGovt.\tof\tIndia.\tThis\tdataset\tis\ta\tdomain-specific\tcorpus\tdeve\boped\tpure\by\tto\tbui\bd\tmachine\t trans\bation\t systems\t catering\t for\t the\t tourism\t domain.\t The\t re\beased\t EILMT\t dataset\t was\t not\t a\t 672 \t discrete\tset\f\ti.e.\tthere\twere\tsome\tcommon\tsentences\tamong\tthe\ttestset\f\tdevset\tand\ttraining\tset.\t Therefore\f\tfor\tproper\teva\buation\twe\thave\tremoved\tthe\tdup\bicate\tsentences\tamong\tthem\tto\tmake\t it\t a\t discrete\t dataset.\t \t The\t training\f\t deve\bopment\t and\t test\t sets\t contain\t 6\f755\f\t 500\t and\t 495\t sentences\trespective\by.\t\t Table 1:\tBase\bine\tresu\bts\ton\tEILMT\tand\tTIDES\tdatasets.\t
Base\bine\t BLEU\t NIST\t METEOR\t WER\t PER\t EILMT\t 10.93\t 4.56\t 28.59\t 82.06\t 65.67\t TIDES\t 9.56\t 4.29\t 37.76\t 83.99\t 62.77\t Concat1

\t 10.78\t 4.65\t 34.18\t 82.28\t 56.48\t \t \tTable 2:\tExperiments\tadding\tdomain-specific\t\bexicon.\t TIDES\tTrain\tData+\tEILMT\t\bexicon\t BLEU\t NIST\t METEOR\t WER\t PER\t LM\t(EILMT)\t 8.25\t 4.31\t 37.08\t 84.61\t 58.54\t LM\t(EILMT+TIDES)2

Base\bine\tresu\bts\tfor\tthe\ttwo\tdata\tsets\tare\treported\tin\tTab\be\t1.\tThe\t accuracy\t of\t the\t EILMT\t base\bine\tsystem\t(10.93\tBLEU)\tis\tmuch\thigher\tthan\tthe\tTIDES\tbase\bine\t system\t (9.56\t BLEU)\f\t a\bthough\tthe\tsize\tof\tthe\tTIDES\ttraining\tdata\tis\ta\bmost\teight\ttimes\tthe\tEILMT\ttraining\tdata.\tOne\t possib\be\treason\tmay\tbe\tthat\tthe\tsentences\tin\tTIDES\tare\tnot\tfaithfu\b\ttrans\bations\ti.e.\f\tthe\ttarget\t sentences\t convey\t on\by\t the\t meaning\t of\t the\t source\t sentences\t in\t the\t best\t possib\be\t way\t in\t the\t target\t\banguage\t(Venkatapathy\f\t2008).\t

Tab\be\t1\tshows\tthat\tconcatenating\tTIDES\ttraining\tdata\twith\tEILMT\ttraining\tdata\t hurts\t the\t trans\bation\tqua\bity\twhen\ttrans\bating\tthe\tEILMT\ttestset\t(0.15\tBLEU\tpoint\tbe\bow\tthe\tbase\bine).\t In\tthe\tabove\tsituation\f\tthe\tout-of-domain\ttraining\tdata\toverwhe\bms\tthe\tin-domain\ttraining\tdata\t due\tto\tthe\tsheer\tre\bative\tsize.\tThis\tresu\bt\tc\bear\by\tindicates\tthe\tnecessity\tof\tcarefu\b\tadaptation\tof\t out-of-domain\tdata\tin\tEng\bish—Hindi\tSMT.\t\t

sections.title: 3.1 Addi\bg a D\fmai\b-Specific Lexic\f\b
paragraphs: Lang\bais\t (2002)\t was\t the\t first\t to\t add\t a\t domain-specific\t \bexicon\t into\t PB-SMT\t to\t improve\t trans\bation\tqua\bity.\tFo\b\bowing\this\tapproach\f\twe\tbui\bd\tan\tSMT\tmode\b\tadding\ta\ttourism-domain\t \bexicon\tto\tthe\t\barge\tTIDES\ttraining\tdata.\tAn\tSMT\tmode\b\tis\tbui\bt\tusing\tthis\tcombined\tdata.\tThe\t experimenta\b\tresu\bts\tare\tshown\tin\tTab\be\t2.\tThe\ttourism-domain\t\bexicon\tis\tobtained\tby\ttraining\t on\tthe\tEILMT\tcorpus\tusing\tthe\tGIZA++\ttoo\bkit3
.\t\t

The\tfirst\trow\tas\twe\b\b\tas\tthe\tsecond\trow\tin\tTab\be\t2\tshow\tthat\tresu\bts\tare\tmuch\t\bower\tacross\t the\ta\b\b\teva\buation\tmetrics\texcept\tMETEOR\tthan\tthe\tresu\bts\tobtained\tby\tconcatenating\tthe\ttwo\t training\t data\t sets\t as\t shown\t in\t Tab\be\t 2.\t The\t system\t produces\t 2.68\t BLEU\t points\t \bess\t than\t the\t concatenation\t mode\b.\t But\f\t surprising\by\t the\t METEOR\t score\t is\t much\t higher\t than\t for\t the\t concatenation\t mode\b\t when\t trans\bating\t EILMT\t testset.\t This\t c\bear\by\t indicates\t that\t we\t need\t further\tstudy\tto\tcombine\tmu\bti-domain\ttraining\tdata.\t\t\t\t

sections.title: 4 D\fmai\b Adap\ta\ti\f\b
paragraphs: In\t this\t section\f\t we\t describe\t the\t domain\t adaptation\t techniques\t that\t we\t app\bied\t to\t our\t experiments\t for\t trans\bation\t and\t \banguage\t mode\b\t adaptation.\t Our\t goa\b\t is\t to\t make\t use\t of\t a\b\b\t avai\bab\be\ttraining\tdata\tto\tbui\bd\t\banguage\tmode\bs\t(LM)\tand\ttrans\bation\tmode\bs\t(TM).\tGenera\b\by\f\t \banguage\t mode\b\t and\t trans\bation\t mode\b\t adaptation\t in\t SMT\t are\t performed\t app\bying\t two\t interpo\bation\tmethods:\t(i)\t\binear\tinterpo\bation\tand\t(ii)\t\bog-\binear\tinterpo\bation.\tWu\tet al.\t(2008)\t pointed\t out\t that\t \bog-\binear\t interpo\bation\t performs\t better\t than\t \binear\by\t interpo\bating mu\btip\be\t \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\S\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t 1 \tConcatenation\tof\tTIDES\tand\tEILMT\ttraining\tset\t(Devset\f\tTestset\tand\tLM\tfrom\tEILMT\tdata)\t 2 \tLog-\binear\tinterpo\bation\tof\tEILMT\tand\tTIDES\t\banguage\tmode\bs\t(This\ttechnique\tis\tdescribed\tin\tSection\t4).\t 3 \tAvai\bab\be\tat\thttp://www.fjoch.com/GIZA++.htm\b\t 673 domain-specific\t \banguage\t mode\bs\t and\t trans\bation\t mode\bs.\t Therefore\f\t we\t interpo\bated\t EILMT\t and\tTIDES\t\banguage\tmode\bs\tand\ttrans\bation\tmode\bs\tusing\ta\t\bog-\binear\tcombination.\t

sections.title: 4.1 La\bguage M\fdel Adap\ta\ti\f\b
paragraphs: We\t used\t the\t \banguage\t mode\bing\t too\bkit\t SRILM\t (Sto\bke\f\t2002)\t to\t bui\bd\t two\t \banguage\t mode\bs\t from\t the\t target\t side\t of\t the\t EILMT\t and\t TIDES\t training\t data.\t We\t performed\t \bog-\binear\t interpo\bation\tof\tmu\bti-domain\ttrans\bation\tmode\bs.\tThis\tresu\bts\tin\ta\tstraight-forward\tcombination\t of\t in-domain\t and\t out-of-domain\t \banguage\t mode\bs.\t Fortunate\by\f\t the\t PB-SMT\t Moses\t decoder\t supports\t \bog-\binear\t combinations\t of\t \banguage\t mode\bs.\t Language\t mode\b\t weights\t are\t optimized\t with\tminimum\terror\trate\ttraining\t(Och\f\t2003).\t

sections.title: 4.2 Tra\bsla\ti\f\b M\fdel Adap\ta\ti\f\b
paragraphs: In\t genera\b\f\t trans\bation\t mode\bs\t are\t bui\bt\t separate\by\t for\t each\t of\t the\t domain\t specific\t corpora.\t These\t mode\bs\t are\t then\t combined\t using\t two\t techniques:\t (i)\t \binear\t interpo\bation\t (ii)\t \bog-\binear\t interpo\bation.\t We\t performed\t the\t \bog-\binear\t interpo\bation\t of\t mu\bti-domain\t trans\bation\t mode\bs.\t There\tare\ttwo\tways\tof\tperforming\t\bog-\binear\tinterpo\bation:\t\t

Mul\tiple Dec\fdi\bg Pa\ths: a\t recent\t feature\t of\t Moses\t is\t mu\btip\be\t decoding\t paths.\t This\t a\bternate\t decoding\t path\t mode\b\t was\t deve\boped\t by\t Birch\tet al.\t (2007).\t Here\t we\t use\t Moses’\t capabi\bities\t to\t use\t different\t decoding\t paths\t for\t trans\bation\t mode\b\t adaptation.\t As\t per\t our\t requirements\f\twe\tused\ttwo\tand\tthree\tdecoding\tpaths\tdepending\tupon\tthe\tnumber\tof\ttrans\bation\t mode\bs.\tEach\tdecoding\tpath\tis\tdedicated\tto\ta\tparticu\bar\ttrans\bation\ttab\be.\tWeights\tfor\teach\ttab\be\t are\toptimized\tby\tminimum\terror\trate\ttraining.\t\tIn\tthis\tapproach\f\tmu\btip\be\t\bexica\bised\treordering\t tab\bes\tare\tintegrated\tin\ta\t\bog-\binear\tcombination\tinto\tthe\tMoses\tframework.\t\t

Da\ta-S\furce I\bdica\t\fr Fea\tures:\tthere\tis\tanother\tapproach\tintroduced\tby\tNakov\t(2008)\tto\t combine\tmu\btip\be\ttrans\bation\ttab\bes\tin\ta\t\bog-\binear\tcombination.\tFor\teach\ttrans\bation\ttab\be\f\tthere\t is\ta\tdata-source\tfeature\twhich\tis\tintegrated\tin\tthe\t\bog-\binear\tcombination\tinto\tMoses.\tThe\tdatasource\t indicator\t features\t distinguish\t different\t domain-specific\t phrases.\t In\t this\t approach\f\t mu\btip\be\t trans\bation\t tab\bes\t are\t combined\t together\t to\t create\t a\t sing\be\t trans\bation\t tab\be\t by\t assigning\ta\tparticu\bar\tva\bue\tfor\teach\tdata-source\tfeature\taccording\tto\tdomain\timportance.\tWe\t refer\tthe\tinterested\treader\tto\tNakov\t(2008)\tfor\tthe\tdetai\bs\tof\thow\tthese\tfeatures\tare\tintegrated\t into\t Moses\t for\t mu\bti-domain\t trans\bation\t tab\bes.\t This\t approach\t is\t a\bso\t app\bicab\be\t to\t combine\t mu\bti-domain\treordering\ttab\bes.\t

sections.title: 4.3 Clus\teri\bg Ou\t-\ff-D\fmai\b C\frpus Da\ta
paragraphs: The\tidea\tis\tto\textract\tsentences\tas\tsimi\bar\tas\tpossib\be\tto\tthe\ttourism\tdomain\tsentences\tfrom\tthe\t out-of-domain\t para\b\be\b\t corpus\t (TIDES).\t Hasan\t and\t Ney\t (2005)\t c\buster\t sentences\t into\t specific\t c\basses\t based\t on\t regu\bar\t expressions.\t They\t measure\t the\t perp\bexity\t of\t sentences\t as\t eva\buation\t criteria.\tYamamoto\tand\tSumita\t(2007)\tapp\bied\tunsupervised\tc\bustering\ton\ta\t bi\bingua\b\t training\t corpus.\tIn\ttheir\tcase\f\teach\tc\buster\tis\tregarded\tas\ta\tdomain.\t C\busters\t are\t defined\t automatica\b\by\t (without\thuman\tknow\bedge)\tand\tcreated\tby\tthe\tentropy\treduction\tbased\tmethod\t(Carter\f\t1994).\t In\tboth\ttechniques\f\tthe\ttota\b\tnumber\tof\tc\busters\tis\tpre-defined\tby\tthe\tuser.\tSimi\bar\by\f\tin\tour\tcase\f\t two\t c\busters\t were\t defined\f\t one\t c\buster\t contains\t sentences\t simi\bar\t to\t the\t tourism\t domain\t sentences\t(EILMT\tcorpus)\f\tthe\tother\tc\buster\tcontains\tthe\tremaining\tsentences.\t\t

We\t bui\bd\t a\t \banguage\t mode\b\t on\t the\t Eng\bish\t side\t of\t the\t EILMT\t bi\bingua\b\t training\t data.\t We\t extract\t high-frequency\t\b-grams\t (upto\t 5-grams)\t and\t their\t probabi\bity\t distribution\t from\t the\t \banguage\tmode\b.\tStop\twords\tare\tremoved\tfrom\tthe\thigh-frequency\t\b-gram\t\bist.\tIntuitive\by\f\tthe\t remaining\t high\t frequency\t\b-gram\t word\t sequences\t are\t tourism\t domain-specific\t termino\bogies.\t For\t c\bustering\t purposes\f\t we\t defined\t a\t simi\barity\t function\t that\t measures\t sentence\t simi\barity\t based\t on\t the\t occurrences\t of\t domain-specific\t\b-grams\t in\t the\t Eng\bish\t sentences\t of\t the\t TIDES\t bi\bingua\b\t training\t data.\t The\t simi\barity\t function\t is\t based\t on\t the\t\b-gram\t over\bap\t metric\f\t which\t ca\bcu\bates\t the\t simi\barity\t score\t of\t an\t input\t sentence\t depending\t on\t the\t number\t of\t over\bapping\t 674 \t domain-specific\t\b-grams\tin\tthat\tsentence.\tThe\tsentence\tsimi\barity\tscore\tis\tderived\tby\tadding\tthe\t \bog-probabi\bities\t of\t a\b\b\t over\bapping\t\b-grams.\t The\t simi\barity\t thresho\bds\t of\t c\busters\t are\t set\t manua\b\by.\t Thus\f\t sentences\t of\t the\t TIDES\t bi\bingua\b\t corpus\t are\t c\bustered\t into\t two\t sub-corpora\t using\t the\t above\t mono\bingua\b\t sentence\t c\bustering\t method.\t The\t first\t c\buster\t is\t a\t sub-corpus\t containing\tpara\b\be\b\tsentences\tsimi\bar\tto\tour\tin-domain\tcorpus.\tThe\tsecond\tc\buster\tcontains\tthe\t remaining\t para\b\be\b\t sentences.\t The\t first\t sub-corpus\t (SUB1)\t contains\t 5893\t sentences\f\t (11.9%)\t which\tare\tc\boser\tto\tin-domain\ttourism\tcorpus.\t\tThe\tremaining\tsentences\tform\tthe\tsecond\tsubcorpus\t(SUB2)\tcontaining\t436111\tsentences.\t

sections.title: 5 Resul\ts a\bd A\balysis
paragraphs: We\tperformed\ttwo\tsets\tof\texperiments.\tThe\tfirst\tset\tof\texperiments\ttests\tthe\tadaptations\tof\tout-of-domain\tTIDES\ttraining\tdata\twith\tin-domain\tEILMT\ttraining\tdata.\tExperimenta\b\tresu\bts\tare\t reported\tin\tTab\be\t3.\tThe\tsecond\tset\tof\texperiments\tis\tperformed\tapp\bying\tadaption\ttechniques\t on\tc\bustered\tsub-corpora\t(SUB1\tand\tSUB2)\twith\tthe\tin-domain\tEILMT\tcorpus.\tExperimenta\b\t resu\bts\t are\t reported\t in\t Tab\be\t 4.\t In\t a\b\b\t our\t adaptation\t experiments\f\t we\t performed\t \bog-\binear\t interpo\bation\tof\tin-domain\tand\tout-of-domain\t\banguage\tmode\bs.\t

Tab\be\t 3\t shows\t that\t when\t data-source\t indicator\t features\t are\t app\bied\t in\t the\t adaptation\t technique\f\tsystem\tperformance\timproves\t0.29\tBLEU\tpoint\tover\tthe\tEILMT\tbase\bine\t(Tab\be\t1).\t When\t domain\t adaptation\t using\t 2-decoding\t paths\t is\t emp\boyed\f\t the\t system\t produces\t a\t 0.19\t BLEU\tpoint\timprovement\tover\tthe\tbase\bine.\t\t\t

The\texperimenta\b\tresu\bts\tof\tc\bustering\tthe\tout-of-domain\ttraining\tdata\tare\treported\tin\tTab\be\t4.\t\t We\t obtained\t a\t 0.44\t BLEU\t improvement\t over\t the\t base\bine\t when\t app\bying\t the\t adaptation\t technique\tusing\tdata-source\tindicator\tfeatures\ton\tEILMT\ttraining\tdata\tand\ttwo\tc\bustered\tsubcorpora.\tThis\texperiment\timproves\tsystem\tperformance\tacross\ta\b\b\tthe\teva\buation\tmetrics.\tA\t3decoding\t path\t adaption\t technique\t on\t EILMT\t training\t data\t and\t two\t c\bustered\t sub-corpora\t resu\bts\tin\tan\timprovement\tof\t0.25\tBLEU\tpoint\tover\tthe\tbase\bine.\t

The\t experimenta\b\t resu\bts\t in\t Tab\be\t 3\t and\t Tab\be\t 4\t c\bear\by\t show\t that\t adaptation\t techniques\t improve\t across\t a\b\b\t the\t eva\buation\t metrics\t over\t the\t base\bine\t resu\bts\t disp\bayed\t in\t Tab\be\t 1.\t This\t indicates\tthe\tusefu\bness\tand\teffectiveness\tof\tapp\bying\tdomain\tadaption\ttechniques\tin\tEng\bish— Hindi\tStatistica\b\tmachine\ttrans\bation.\t\t\t

sections.title: 6 C\f\bclusi\f\b a\bd Fu\ture W\frk
paragraphs: Lexica\b\t coverage\t is\t an\t important\t issue\t when\t an\t SMT\t system\t is\t bui\bt\f\t particu\bar\by\t with\t \banguages\t with\t sma\b\b-sca\be\t training\t data.\t But\f\t this\t prob\bem\t wi\b\b\t worsen\t if\t out-of-domain\t training\tdata\tis\tadded\tin\tan\timproper\tway.\tApp\bying\tdomain\tadaptation\ttechniques\tto\tcombine\t 675 mu\btip\be\tdomain\tcorpora\f\twe\thave\tsuccessfu\b\by\tincreased\tthe\t\bexica\b\tcoverage\tin\tan\tSMT\tmode\b\t with\t improved\t system\t performance.\t The\t highest\t improvement\t in\t terms\t of\t BLEU\t (4.03%\t re\bative)\t is\t achieved\t when\t a\t domain\t adaption\t technique\t by\t data-source\t indicator\t feature\t is\t app\bied\ton\tc\bustered\tsub-corpora\tand\tin-domain\ttraining\tdata.\tTherefore\f\tc\bustering\ta\t\barge\tout-of-domain\tcorpus\tto\textract\tsentences\tsimi\bar\tto\tan\tin-domain\tcorpus\tis\tan\tinteresting\tfinding\t of\t this\t research.\t Domain\t adaptation\t techniques\t using\t mu\btip\be\t domain\t data\t have\t been\t successfu\b\by\temp\boyed\ton\ta\tnew\t\banguage\tpair\tEng\bish—Hindi.\tTo\tthe\tbest\tof\tour\tknow\bedge\f\t no\tresearch\thas\tbeen\tpub\bished\tto\tdate\ton\tdomain\tadaptation\tin\tSMT\ton\tIndian\t\banguages.\t\t

The\t improvement\t in\t trans\bation\t qua\bity\t is\t definite\by\t due\t to\t the\t better\t \bexica\b\t coverage\t of\t phrases.\t In\t future\f\t we\t want\t to\t perform\t a\t manua\b\t eva\buation\t on\t the\t output\t to\t see\t how\t the\t adapted\t system’s\t trans\bation\t differs\t from\t base\bine\t trans\bation.\t For\t c\bustering\t purposes\f\t we\t defined\ta\tsimp\be\tsimi\barity\tfunction\twhich\tis\tbased\ton\tan\t\b-gram\tover\bap\tmetric.\tIn\tfuture\f\twe\t want\t to\t improve\t the\t simi\barity\t function\t by\t substituting\t the\t\b-gram\t over\bap\t metric\t with\t a\t weighted\t\b-gram\tover\bap\tmetric\t(setting\t\barger\tweights\tfor\tthe\t\bonger\t\b-gram\tword\tsequences).\t In\tthe\tpresent\twork\f\ta\tbi\bingua\b\tout-of-domain\tcorpus\tis\tc\bustered\tbased\ton\tthe\toccurrences\tof\t domain-specific\t\b-grams\t in\t the\t source\t \banguage.\t In\t future\f\t we\t want\t to\t consider\t the\t target\t \banguage\t as\t we\b\b\t as\t the\t source\t \banguage.\t We\t a\bso\t intend\t to\t investigate\t trans\bating\t Hindi— Eng\bish\tto\tsee\twhether\tsimi\bar\timprovements\tare\tachieved.\tWe\ta\bso\twant\tto\tautomatica\b\by\ttune\t the\tthresho\bd\tva\bue\tfor\tc\bustering\tbased\ton\tmachine\ttrans\bation\teva\buation\tmetric.\t
